intro: Diasperus mocinoanus, commonly known as the Mocino's rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Diasperus mocinoanus is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, with a short growing season and the ability to store water in its leaves.
